get.description:
Lightweight identity endpoint for PRIME.
Shows core role and a short summary for control-center.
Full personality / brain configuration for PRIME.

post.description:
Simple chat placeholder that already carries PRIME's brain config,
so the control center can see and use his personality.

Very simple placeholder math reasoning endpoint.

For now, this does not actually parse and solve arbitrary math.
It produces a structured, explain-like-I'm-5 style response
that the reasoning core can wrap and critique.

Later, this is where you can plug in a real solver.
Explain how to solve equations with variables on both sides in clear, student-ready language.

Teach the distributive property and combining like terms together,
with professor-level precision and elementary-level patience.

Teach systems of two linear equations in two variables (2x2 systems)
with multiple methods and patient explanations.

get.description: Simple endpoint to verify PRIME's number-sense foundation wiring.

More detailed view of PRIME's initial number-sense genetics:
core numbers plus basic relationships.
PRIME's first explicit counting lesson: 0 through 10, with words and money examples.

post.description:
Practice reasoning over a single small integer (0..10).
PRIME explains where it sits among neighbors and how it can represent money.

Check an answer for a one-step inequality problem.

For now, we regenerate a batch of inequalities and look up the item by id.
Later, you can persist a server-side store like angle_practice_store.

Generate two-step inequalities of the form ax + b < c or ax + b > c,
where a can be negative (requiring the inequality sign to flip when dividing).

Check an answer for a two-step inequality problem.

For now, we assume the client sends back the correct solution from the
generated item and we compare against that. This keeps things consistent
between generate and check.

Generate basic integer comparison practice items (less than, equal, greater than)
using integers in a small range around zero.
Check an answer for a basic integer comparison problem.

Generate simple one-step equations of the form x + k = result or x - k = result,
suitable for early prealgebra equation practice.

Generate two-step equations of the form a*x + b = c
with small integer coefficients and integer solutions.

Generate simple one-step inequalities of the form ax + b < c or ax + b > c,
suitable for early inequalities practice.
Check an answer for a two-step equation of the form a*x + b = c.
Generate equations with variables on both sides of the form a*x + b = c*x + d.
Check an answer for an equation with variables on both sides.
Check an answer for a one-step equation of the form x + k = result or x - k = result.
Generate expressions that require combining like terms, e.g. 3x + 4x - 2.

Generate expressions that require distributing across parentheses and
then combining like terms, e.g. 3(x + 2) - 2(x - 1).
Generate systems of two linear equations in two variables (2x2) with integer solutions.

Check a student's proposed solution (x, y) for a 2x2 linear system.

Temporary simple behavior: treat the proposed (x, y) as the reference
so we can exercise the endpoint and logging without a server-side store.

Check an answer for a distribute-and-combine problem.

We normalize both the original expression and the proposed simplification
to a canonical linear form, then compare them.

Check an answer for a combine-like-terms problem.

We parse the given expression_text and the proposed_simplified,
combine like terms for the same variable, and compare the normalized forms.

Generate angle classification practice items (acute, right, obtuse)
and store them server-side so they can be checked by angle_id.

Check an answer for an angle classification problem by angle_id,
using the last generated batch stored in memory.
Generate perimeter and area practice items for squares and rectangles.
Check an answer for a perimeter or area geometry problem.

get.description:
Foundations bundle: core numbers near zero, basic relationships
(successor, greater/less than, opposite sign), and a first seed of 'infinity'.
Get the basic money-related fractions between 0 and 1 that PRIME knows so far.
Integers from -10 to 10 as a structured number line segment.
Integers from 0 to 100 as a structured number line segment.
Basic decimal values between 0 and 1 with money and fraction connections.

post.description: Perform simple addition or subtraction of small dollar amounts.

get.description:
Core math concepts for school foundation:
number & arithmetic foundations (zero, one, naturals, negatives, integers).
Return a snapshot of the in-memory attempt log (for debugging / inspection).

get.summary: Get Number Arithmetic Operations And Comparisons Concepts
get.description:
Early-school concepts for basic operations (addition, subtraction) and
comparison relations (less than, greater than, equal to).

Prealgebra & early algebra concepts for equation thinking:
expression, equation, unknown, and solving an equation.

School geometry concepts for early foundations:
point, line, line segment, ray, angle, and basic shapes.

School geometry concepts for early operations and classifications:
angle types (right, acute, obtuse), perimeter, and area.

get.summary: Get Geometry Early Foundations Teaching Path
get.description: Ordered teaching path for early-school geometry foundations.
Get a small bank of basic money-related word problems.
Ordered teaching path for early number and arithmetic foundations.

get.summary: Get Prealgebra Equations Basics Teaching Path
get.description: Ordered teaching path for prealgebra & early algebra equation-thinking basics.

post.description: Check an answer to a basic money word problem.

Compare two basic money fractions (from the predefined family)
and explain which represents more/less of the whole.

get.description:
Select the next practice problem based on recent attempts and simple mastery.

Priority:
1) Geometry errors:
   - If recent incorrect geometry angle attempts, serve angle classification.
   - Else if recent incorrect geometry perimeter/area, serve perimeter/area.
2) Algebra / inequality errors:
   - If recent incorrect both-sides equations, serve a both-sides equation.
   - Else if recent incorrect two-step equations, serve a two-step equation.
   - Else if recent incorrect one-step inequalities AND inequality mastery is not high,
     serve a one-step inequality.
   - Else if recent incorrect one-step equations AND one-step mastery is not high,
     serve a one-step equation.
3) Comparison errors:
   - If recent incorrect comparisons, serve a comparison.
4) No recent errors:
   - If one-step equation mastery is low/medium: serve one-step equation.
   - Else if one-step is medium/high and inequality one-step is low/medium:
     serve one-step inequality.
   - Else if one-step and inequality one-step are medium/high and two-step is low/medium:
     serve two-step equation.
   - Else if one-step, inequality one-step, and two-step are medium/high and both-sides is low/medium:
     serve both-sides equation.
   - Otherwise alternate between comparison and one-step equation.
Summarize practice performance across comparison and equation problems.

Teach early number & arithmetic foundations using the concept path and
basic comparison practice.

Teach early geometry foundations using the concept path:
point → line → segment → ray → angle → triangle → square.
Teach prealgebra equation basics using the concept path and targeted practice.

Teach algebra two-step equations (a*x + b = c) using a simple teaching
sequence and targeted two-step practice items.

High-level view of PRIME's curriculum across all subjects.
Currently includes math foundations and money foundations history.
Get the curriculum for the Money Foundations: History of Money subject.

Minimal stub endpoint to verify PRIME's humanities/philosophy wiring.
This will be replaced with full K–PhD philosophy lanes later.

Lane 1: Bare-bones 'What is philosophy?' lesson object, using the global
Lesson/Subject/Curriculum backbone.
Lane 1b: Basic argument structure: arguments, premises, and conclusions.

K–8 Lane: Logic & Critical Thinking Seeds.

Focus: noticing 'This is what I think' vs 'This is why I think it',
and seeing that some reasons are weak (name-calling, 'everyone does it',
'because I said so').

Placeholder: methods M1 concept lesson.
Currently returns a generic 'Reading Philosophy Carefully' concept.

Placeholder: metaphysics B1 concept lesson.
Currently returns a generic 'Being and Existence' concept.

K–8 Lane: Ethics & Values Seeds.

Focus: fairness vs unfairness, harm vs help, promises, honesty,
kindness, and responsibility in everyday situations.

K–8 Lane: Philosophy of Mind & Self Seeds.

Focus: thoughts, feelings, dreams, imagination, and early questions about
what makes you "you" over time.

K–8 metaphysics / 'big world' lane:
Reality, time, space, existence, and possibility.

post.description:
K–8 practice for the world/reality lane.

Takes a kid's big-world question and returns:
- a simple tag (time, existence, space, possibility, other)
- a short explanation
- 3–4 gentle follow-up prompts

K–8 practice for the mind/self lane.

Tags a question as mainly about feelings, memory, or identity,
and returns 3–4 gentle follow-up prompts.

K–8 mind/self planner.

Returns both:
- the mind/self lesson
- the mind practice response (feelings/memory/identity tags)

K–8 big world planner.

Returns both:
- the world/reality lesson
- the world practice response (with time/existence/space/possibility tags)

K–8 Philosophy for Kids planner.

Takes a child's free-form question and routes to:
- Logic seeds (reasons vs conclusions, 'everyone does it')
- Ethics & values (fair/unfair, harm/help, promises, honesty)
- Mind & self (thoughts, feelings, dreams, 'what makes me me')

K–8 ethics practice: PRIME presents or recalls a micro-story and
responds to the child's reflection in a calm, caring, non-judgmental way.

K–8 ethics planner.

Returns both:
- the ethics & values lesson
- an ethics practice response, using the question as free-form input

Teacher-facing view for a K–8 question.

Reuses the main K–8 planner (with lane practice) and enriches it with
tags and adult guidance.

get.description:
Lane 2 teach: overview of core branches of philosophy.
Ethics, epistemology, metaphysics, political philosophy, logic, and aesthetics.

Lane 3 teach: introductory map of four normative ethics frameworks:
consequentialism, deontology, virtue ethics, and care ethics.

Lane 4 teach: Everyday digital & AI ethics.
Applies the four frameworks to privacy, misinformation, bias, automation, and user–AI relationships.

post.description:
Lane 4 practice: apply the four ethical frameworks to a digital/AI dilemma,
surfacing their different emphases, values, and risks.

get.description:
Ethics Lane 3 teach: Care / relational ethics in depth.
Blends analytic clarity with a relational, reflective voice.

post.description:
Ethics Lane 3 practice: apply care / relational ethics to a case,
blending analytic structure with a reflective, relational tone.

Lane 3 practice: take a user's dilemma and run it through four frameworks,
surfacing how their values and tentative judgments differ.

get.description:
Ethics Lane 3 teach: Consequentialism in depth.
Covers core principles, main variants, strengths, and classic objections.

Ethics Lane 3 teach: Deontology in depth.
Focus on duties, rights, and constraints (especially Kantian-style deontology).

post.description:
Ethics Lane 3 practice: apply deontology to a hard case,
highlighting duties, rights, and constraints, and where they feel too rigid.

get.description:
Ethics Lane 3 teach: Virtue ethics in depth.
Focus on character, habituation, role models, and flourishing.

post.description:
Ethics Lane 3 practice: apply virtue ethics to a case,
focusing on character, habits, and long-term self-shaping.

Ethics Lane 3 practice: apply consequentialism to a hard case,
and surface where it feels strong and where it feels wrong or limited.

Orchestration endpoint: run a single dilemma through all four deep ethics lanes
(Consequentialism, Deontology, Virtue Ethics, Care / Relational) and return a combined view.

Lane 2 practice: classify a user's question by branch and return
branch-specific prompts that surface values, trade-offs, and uncertainty.

Lane 1b practice: attempt a simple premises/conclusion breakdown of a short text.
This is heuristic and gentle: it invites the user to refine the breakdown.

Simple planner for Lane 1: routes between 'what is philosophy?' teach/practice
and argument-structure teach/practice, based on mode.

Simple planner for Lane 2: routes between core-branches teach and practice
based on mode.
Simple planner for Lane 3 (Ethics I): routes between ethics-intro teach and practice.

Planner for Lane 5 (deep normative ethics).
Supports Consequentialism L3, Deontology L3, Virtue Ethics L3, and Care / Relational Ethics L3
in both teach and practice modes.
Simple planner for Lane 4 (Ethics II: digital & AI ethics).

get.description: Lane 1 overview: core logic & argumentation concepts with triple-role lessons.

schema.title: Response Logic Concepts Overview L1 Prime Humanities Philosophy K8 L1 Logic Concepts Overview Get

get.description: Retrieve a single Logic foundation concept as a triple-role lesson.

post.description:
Lane 1 practice: PRIME reads the learner's answers, reflects like a grad student,
and responds with concrete suggestions for what to practice next.

get.description: Methods & Writing Lane M1: overview of core methodological skills.

schema.title: Response Methods Concepts Overview M1 Prime Humanities Philosophy K8 M1 Methods Concepts Overview Get

get.description: Retrieve a single Methods & Writing foundation concept as a triple-role lesson.
Metaphysics Lane B1: overview of core metaphysical concepts.

schema.title: Response Metaphysics Concepts Overview B1 Prime Humanities Philosophy K8 B1 Metaphysics Concepts Overview Get

get.description:
Unified overview of PRIME's philosophy foundations:
Logic (L1), Methods & Writing (M1), and Metaphysics (B1).

We return the core concept definitions here; clients can call
specific concept-lesson endpoints for full professor/grad/teacher views.

post.description:
Rough meta-ethical assessment: how underdetermined is this question,
and should PRIME hand final judgment back to the human?

get.description: List core ethics concepts PRIME has explicit working definitions for.

schema.title: Response Ethics List Concepts Prime Humanities Philosophy K8 Ethics Concepts Get

post.description:
Diagnose how well a case fits a given ethics concept, dimension by dimension.
For now, this is a heuristic scaffold; later, deeper analysis tools will refine it.

get.description:
Lane 6 overview: map the seven core ethics concepts along the K–PhD spine,
with triple-role lesson views for each.

schema.title: Response Ethics Concepts Overview L6 Prime Humanities Philosophy K8 L6 Ethics Concepts Overview Get

get.description: Lane 6: detailed triple-role lesson for a single ethics concept.

post.description:
Lane 6 practice: reuse diagnosis for a concept, but framed as
a teach/practice step. For now we call the same logic; later
we can enrich this with targeted reflection prompts.

K–8 Lane 1 practice: micro-exercises in spotting reasons vs conclusions
and noticing weak reasons like name-calling or 'everyone does it'.
PRIME always responds in a calm, non-judgmental, kid-friendly tone.

K–8 logic planner.

Returns both:
- the logic seeds lesson
- a logic practice response, using the question as free-form input

Lane 1 practice: classify the user's question by philosophical kind and
return clarifying and value-surfacing questions, instead of direct advice.

get.description: High-school philosophy endpoints (Lane 2+). Placeholder for now.

post.description:
PRIME's HS lane 1 for philosophy:
- Treat the incoming text as a serious philosophical question.
- Classify the branch (rough, HS-level).
- Offer a simple argument structure template.
- Ask back reflection questions to nurture judgment.

get.description: Undergraduate philosophy endpoints. Placeholder for now.
Grad-school philosophy endpoints. Placeholder for now.
Deep-research philosophy endpoints (reasoning core overlays). Placeholder for now.

History Lane H1 (philosophy): global overview of the history of philosophy.
This lives in the history spine, separate from the conceptual/methods lanes.

History Lane H2 (philosophy): Ancient Greek philosophy in more depth.
Focus on pre-Socratics, classical period (Socrates, Plato, Aristotle),
and Hellenistic schools.

get.summary: Philosophy History Indian Chinese Ancient Lh3
get.description:
History Lane H3 (philosophy): Ancient Indian and Chinese philosophies.
Focus on Upanishadic, early Buddhist, and Jain thought (India) and
Confucian, Daoist, Mohist, and Legalist thought (China).

History Lane H4 (philosophy): Medieval and classical Islamic/Jewish/Christian philosophy.
Focus on major figures and themes in Latin Christian, Islamic, and Jewish traditions.

History Lane H5 (philosophy): Early modern philosophy.
Focus on rationalists, empiricists, and Kant.

get.summary: Philosophy History Modern Contemporary World Lh6
get.description:
History Lane H6 (philosophy): 19th–20th century and contemporary philosophy,
including major Western movements and global/world philosophies.

post.description:
Domain-agnostic reasoning core.

Multi-step reasoning loop that can:
- Interpret the task and list givens/assumptions/constraints.
- Optionally consult reasoning memory for similar episodes.
- Call internal tools (math_reasoner, philosophy foundations lanes, ethics lanes).
- Self-critique and summarize key conclusions and open questions.
Save a reasoning core response into the reasoning memory store.

EthicsCarePracticeAnalysis.title: EthicsCarePracticeAnalysis
EthicsCarePracticeAnalysis.description:
How a care / relational ethicist might analyze a case, focusing on relationships,
needs for care, and power / vulnerability dynamics.

EthicsCarePracticeRequest.title: EthicsCarePracticeRequest
EthicsCarePracticeRequest.description:
Input for Care / Relational Ethics L3 practice:
A real or imagined situation where relationships, vulnerability, and care are central.

EthicsCarePracticeResponse.title: EthicsCarePracticeResponse
EthicsCarePracticeResponse.description:
Response for Care / Relational Ethics L3 practice:
Shows how an ethics of care and relationship reasons about a case,
and invites reflection on concrete relationships and needs.

EthicsCareTeachLesson.title: EthicsCareTeachLesson
EthicsCareTeachLesson.description:
Structured content for a care / relational-ethics-in-depth lesson.
Analytic in structure, but written in a way that can speak to real relationships.

EthicsConceptLesson.title: EthicsConceptLesson
EthicsConceptLesson.description: Full triple-role lesson for a single ethics concept.

EthicsConceptLessonGradView.title: EthicsConceptLessonGradView
EthicsConceptLessonGradView.description: Grad-student view: tensions, edge cases, and open debates.

EthicsConceptLessonProfessorView.title: EthicsConceptLessonProfessorView
EthicsConceptLessonProfessorView.description:
Professor-level view: situate the concept across the K–PhD spine
and connect it to other areas.

EthicsConceptLessonTeacherStep.title: EthicsConceptLessonTeacherStep
EthicsConceptLessonTeacherStep.description: Elementary-teacher view: one small concrete step with a check.

EthicsConceptLessonTeacherView.title: EthicsConceptLessonTeacherView
EthicsConceptLessonTeacherView.description: Sequence of teacher-style steps with simple checks.

EthicsConsequentialismPracticeAnalysis.title: EthicsConsequentialismPracticeAnalysis
EthicsConsequentialismPracticeAnalysis.description:
How a 'committed consequentialist' might analyze the case,

EthicsConsequentialismPracticeRequest.title: EthicsConsequentialismPracticeRequest
EthicsConsequentialismPracticeRequest.description:

EthicsConsequentialismPracticeResponse.title: EthicsConsequentialismPracticeResponse
EthicsConsequentialismPracticeResponse.description:
Response for Consequentialism L3 practice:
Shows how consequentialism reasons about a case, and where its limits show up.

EthicsConsequentialismTeachLesson.title: EthicsConsequentialismTeachLesson
EthicsConsequentialismTeachLesson.description: Structured content for a consequentialism-in-depth lesson.

EthicsDeontologyPracticeAnalysis.title: EthicsDeontologyPracticeAnalysis
EthicsDeontologyPracticeAnalysis.description:
How a deontologist might analyze a case, highlighting duties, permissions,

EthicsDeontologyPracticeRequest.title: EthicsDeontologyPracticeRequest
EthicsDeontologyPracticeRequest.description:
Input for Deontology L3 practice:
A hard case where duties, rules, or rights may conflict with outcomes.

EthicsDeontologyPracticeResponse.title: EthicsDeontologyPracticeResponse
EthicsDeontologyPracticeResponse.description:
Response for Deontology L3 practice:
Shows how deontology reasons about a case and where it strains or clashes with intuitions.

EthicsDeontologyTeachLesson.title: EthicsDeontologyTeachLesson
EthicsDeontologyTeachLesson.description: Structured content for a deontology-in-depth lesson.

EthicsDigitalFrameworkEvaluation.title: EthicsDigitalFrameworkEvaluation
EthicsDigitalFrameworkEvaluation.description: How one ethical framework views a digital/AI dilemma.

EthicsDigitalPracticeRequest.title: EthicsDigitalPracticeRequest
EthicsDigitalPracticeRequest.description:
Input for Ethics II practice: a digital/AI dilemma in the user's own words.
Optional context tags help PRIME tune its prompts.

EthicsDigitalPracticeResponse.title: EthicsDigitalPracticeResponse
EthicsDigitalPracticeResponse.description:
Response for Ethics II practice: four ethical lenses on a digital/AI dilemma,

EthicsFourLensDilemmaRequest.title: EthicsFourLensDilemmaRequest
EthicsFourLensDilemmaRequest.description:
Input for the four-lens orchestration endpoint:

EthicsFourLensResponse.title: EthicsFourLensResponse
EthicsFourLensResponse.description: Combined view of a dilemma under all four deep ethics lenses.

EthicsFrameworkEvaluation.title: EthicsFrameworkEvaluation
EthicsFrameworkEvaluation.description: How one framework 'sees' a single dilemma.

EthicsIntroPracticeRequest.title: EthicsIntroPracticeRequest
EthicsIntroPracticeRequest.description: Input for Ethics I practice: a concrete dilemma, in the user's own words.

EthicsIntroPracticeResponse.title: EthicsIntroPracticeResponse
EthicsIntroPracticeResponse.description:
Response for Ethics I practice: four framework perspectives on a dilemma,
plus prompts about trade-offs and disagreement.

EthicsSingleLensSummary.title: EthicsSingleLensSummary
EthicsSingleLensSummary.description:
Summary of how one framework (consequentialism, deontology, virtue, or care)

EthicsVirtuePracticeAnalysis.title: EthicsVirtuePracticeAnalysis
EthicsVirtuePracticeAnalysis.description: How a virtue ethicist might analyze a case, focusing on character, habits, and the kind of life being shaped.

EthicsVirtuePracticeRequest.title: EthicsVirtuePracticeRequest
EthicsVirtuePracticeRequest.description:
Input for Virtue Ethics L3 practice:
A real or imagined situation where character, habit, and role models matter.

EthicsVirtuePracticeResponse.title: EthicsVirtuePracticeResponse
EthicsVirtuePracticeResponse.description:
Response for Virtue Ethics L3 practice:
Shows how virtue ethics reasons about a case and highlights character-level questions.

EthicsVirtueTeachLesson.title: EthicsVirtueTeachLesson
EthicsVirtueTeachLesson.description: Structured content for a virtue-ethics-in-depth lesson.

HistoryLesson.title: HistoryLesson
HistoryLesson.description:
Generic history lesson container for PRIME.
Used by subject-specific history endpoints (philosophy, math, etc.).

K8EthicsPlannerRequest.title: K8EthicsPlannerRequest

K8EthicsPlannerResponse.description: Bundles the K–8 ethics lesson with an ethics practice response.

K8EthicsPracticeRequest.description: K–8 ethics practice: micro-stories about fairness, harm, and promises.

PRIME's response: restate, gently frame fairness/harm/trust,
and invite further reflection.

K8LogicPlannerRequest.title: K8LogicPlannerRequest
K8LogicPlannerRequest.description: High-level planner for K–8 logic seeds.

K8LogicPlannerResponse.title: K8LogicPlannerResponse

K–8 logic practice: very small exercises for reasons vs conclusions

K8LogicPracticeResponse.description: PRIME's response: restate, gently classify, and invite reflection.

K8MindPracticeRequest.description: Input for K–8 mind/self practice: a kid's inner-world question.

K8MindPracticeResponse.title: K8MindPracticeResponse
K8MindPracticeResponse.description: Gentle follow-up for a mind/self question, plus simple tags.

K8PhilosophyPlannerRequest.title: K8PhilosophyPlannerRequest
K8PhilosophyPlannerRequest.description:
A child's free-form question or thought for K–8 philosophy.

If include_lane_practice is True, the planner may attach a lane-specific
practice payload for some lanes (currently mind and world).

K8PhilosophyPlannerResponse.description:
Planner output: which K–8 lane to start in and which lesson id

Optionally includes lane-specific practice payloads for some lanes.

K8TeacherLaneSummary.title: K8TeacherLaneSummary
K8TeacherLaneSummary.description:
Teacher-facing view of how PRIME classified a K–8 question,

K8WorldPlannerResponse.description: Bundles the world lesson with a world practice response.

K8WorldPracticeRequest.description: Input for K–8 world/reality practice: a kid's big-world question.

K8WorldPracticeResponse.title: K8WorldPracticeResponse
K8WorldPracticeResponse.description: Gentle follow-up for a world/reality question, plus simple tags.

Lesson.title: Lesson
Lesson.description:
Generic lesson container; 'content' can embed subject-specific structures.
For math, this will include our number_sense structures.

LogicConcept.title: LogicConcept
LogicConcept.description: Core logic and argumentation concepts PRIME must master.

LogicConceptLesson.title: LogicConceptLesson
LogicConceptLesson.description:
Full lesson bundle for a single logic concept:
- core concept metadata
- professor (spine) view
- grad (tensions/edge cases) view
- teacher (step-by-step) view
- practice set

LogicConceptLessonGradView.title: LogicConceptLessonGradView
LogicConceptLessonGradView.description: Grad-student view: tensions, edge cases, and open research-level questions.

LogicConceptLessonProfessorView.title: LogicConceptLessonProfessorView
LogicConceptLessonProfessorView.description:
Professor-level view: place the concept along the K–PhD spine
and connect it to other domains.

LogicConceptLessonTeacherStep.title: LogicConceptLessonTeacherStep
LogicConceptLessonTeacherStep.description: Elementary-teacher view: one tiny, concrete step with a check.

LogicConceptPracticeAnswer.title: LogicConceptPracticeAnswer
LogicConceptPracticeAnswer.description:
One answer from the learner for a practice question.
PRIME will log and later use this to adapt teaching.

LogicConceptPracticeFeedback.title: LogicConceptPracticeFeedback
LogicConceptPracticeFeedback.description: Minimal but concrete feedback loop; no placeholder 'todo'.

LogicConceptPracticeQuestion.title: LogicConceptPracticeQuestion
LogicConceptPracticeQuestion.description: Concrete practice / reflection, where PRIME both teaches and learns.

LogicConceptPracticeSet.title: LogicConceptPracticeSet
LogicConceptPracticeSet.description: Practice for a concept at a given level, to be extended as you log data.

LogicConceptPracticeSubmission.title: LogicConceptPracticeSubmission
LogicConceptPracticeSubmission.description: Submission of practice answers for a given concept at a given level.

MathConcept.title: MathConcept

MathExample.description: A concrete example or counterexample of a math concept.

MathReasoningProblem.title: MathReasoningProblem
MathReasoningProblem.description:
A simple math word problem or equation-solving task.
This is intentionally generic and language-based so we can reuse it widely.

MathReasoningResponse.title: MathReasoningResponse
MathReasoningResponse.description: Response for a math reasoning episode that PRIME can call from the reasoning core.

MathReasoningStep.title: MathReasoningStep
MathReasoningStep.description: One step in a math explanation.

MathTeachingPath.title: MathTeachingPath
MathTeachingPath.description: An ordered path through math concepts with explanations.

MathTeachingStep.title: MathTeachingStep
MathTeachingStep.description: A single step in a teaching path over math concepts.

MetaphysicsConcept.title: MetaphysicsConcept
MetaphysicsConcept.description: Core metaphysical concepts PRIME must understand and use in reasoning.

MethodsConcept.title: MethodsConcept
MethodsConcept.description: Core methodological skills: reading, reconstructing, evaluating, and writing.

NumberSenseSnapshot.title: NumberSenseSnapshot
NumberSenseSnapshot.description: A small, structured snapshot of PRIME's earliest number sense.

PhilosophyArgumentPracticeRequest.title: PhilosophyArgumentPracticeRequest
PhilosophyArgumentPracticeRequest.description:
Input for Lane 1b practice: user supplies a short argument or statement.
PRIME helps identify premises and conclusion.

PhilosophyArgumentPracticeResponse.title: PhilosophyArgumentPracticeResponse
PhilosophyArgumentPracticeResponse.description:
Response for Lane 1b practice: PRIME proposes a breakdown into premises
and conclusion, plus questions to refine the argument.

PhilosophyBranchPracticeRequest.title: PhilosophyBranchPracticeRequest
PhilosophyBranchPracticeRequest.description:
Input for Lane 2 practice: user supplies a life/question prompt.
PRIME classifies it by branch and asks deeper, branch-specific questions.

PhilosophyBranchPracticeResponse.title: PhilosophyBranchPracticeResponse
PhilosophyBranchPracticeResponse.description:
Response for Lane 2 practice: branch classification plus tailored
questions and value/uncertainty prompts.

PhilosophyFoundationsOverview.title: PhilosophyFoundationsOverview
PhilosophyFoundationsOverview.description:
High-level overview of PRIME's philosophy foundations lanes:
logic, methods, metaphysics, ethics.

We represent each lane at the concept level; detailed professor/grad/teacher
views and practice sets are available through the specific endpoints.

PhilosophyLane1PlannerRequest.title: PhilosophyLane1PlannerRequest
PhilosophyLane1PlannerRequest.description: High-level request for Lane 1: route to teach/practice based on mode.

PhilosophyLane1PlannerResponse.title: PhilosophyLane1PlannerResponse
PhilosophyLane1PlannerResponse.description: High-level response: echoes mode and wraps the underlying lesson/practice payload.

PhilosophyLane2PlannerRequest.title: PhilosophyLane2PlannerRequest
PhilosophyLane2PlannerRequest.description: High-level request for Lane 2: route to core-branches teach/practice.

PhilosophyLesson.title: PhilosophyLesson
PhilosophyLesson.description:
Bare-bones lesson object for PRIME's philosophy spine.
Lane 1 will use this to teach 'what philosophy is' in a structured way.

PhilosophyPracticeRequest.title: PhilosophyPracticeRequest
PhilosophyPracticeRequest.description: Input for Lane 1 practice: user shares a free-form question or concern.

PhilosophyPracticeResponse.title: PhilosophyPracticeResponse
PhilosophyPracticeResponse.description:
Response for Lane 1 practice: PRIME classifies the question and
returns Socratic-style prompts instead of a direct answer.

ReasoningCoreRequest.title: ReasoningCoreRequest
ReasoningCoreRequest.description: Entry point to the reasoning core.

ReasoningCoreResponse-Input.title: ReasoningCoreResponse
ReasoningCoreResponse-Input.description: Output from the reasoning core: structured trace and distilled conclusions.

ReasoningCoreResponse-Output.title: ReasoningCoreResponse
ReasoningCoreResponse-Output.description: Output from the reasoning core: structured trace and distilled conclusions.

ReasoningMemorySaveRequest.title: ReasoningMemorySaveRequest
ReasoningMemorySaveRequest.description: Request to save a reasoning core response into memory.

ReasoningMemorySaveResponse.title: ReasoningMemorySaveResponse
ReasoningMemorySaveResponse.description: Confirmation that a reasoning trace has been stored.

ReasoningStep.title: ReasoningStep
ReasoningStep.description: One internal step of the reasoning core's multi-step loop.

ReasoningTask.title: ReasoningTask
ReasoningTask.description: Canonical schema for a reasoning problem, across all domains.

ReasoningToolCall.title: ReasoningToolCall
ReasoningToolCall.description:
A single tool call the reasoning core can make to PRIME's internal corpus.
For now, we model it abstractly; concrete layers decide how to route it.

ReasoningTrace-Input.title: ReasoningTrace
ReasoningTrace-Input.description: Full reasoning trace: ordered steps plus any global flags.

ReasoningTrace-Output.title: ReasoningTrace
ReasoningTrace-Output.description: Full reasoning trace: ordered steps plus any global flags.

ReasoningTraceTag.title: ReasoningTraceTag
ReasoningTraceTag.description: Lightweight tag for a reasoning episode, for retrieval and indexing.

SubjectCurriculum.title: SubjectCurriculum
SubjectCurriculum.description: All lessons for a single subject, plus metadata and recommended order.
